settings.editor:
What is Scuba Diving in Dubai?

 

Let us take you on an awesome scuba diving adventure—a day of unbridled fun and thrill. Consequently, you are sure to love the packages we have curated for seasoned divers. No certainly, we don’t disappoint those eager to master the skill of scuba diving. We also train those who are learners. So, do visit this amazing tourist attraction in Dubai.

  1. Diverse Marine Life: Dubai's coastal waters are teeming with diverse marine life. You can encounter colourful coral reefs, schools of tropical fish, and even larger marine species like turtles, sharks, and rays.
  2. World-Class Dive Sites: Dubai boasts several world-class dive sites, including:
    • The Dubai Aquarium: Located within the Dubai Mall, this is a unique opportunity for divers to explore the aquarium's massive tank alongside sharks and rays.
    • The Inchcape 2 Wreck: A popular wreck dive site, this sunken tugboat has become an artificial reef for marine life and offers an intriguing underwater experience.
    • Zainab Wreck: This cargo shipwreck, lying at a depth of 30 meters, is a haven for marine life and a favourite among advanced divers.
  3. Year-Round Diving: Dubai's warm climate allows for year-round diving. The water temperature remains pleasant, making it suitable for both beginners and experienced divers.
  4. Professional Dive Centers: Dubai hosts numerous dive centres that offer PADI and SSI-certified courses, ensuring safe and enjoyable experiences for all levels of divers.

What to Expect in Scuba Diving In Dubai 

The program is accredited by PADI. Well-trained experts who are very particular about safety will guide you. Furthermore, your hands will be held by our trainers as you explore the mesmerizing world of scuba diving. We offer everything, from beach scuba diving and diving trips starting from the shores to packages that are perfect for groups and some individuals. It is our responsibility to satisfy your passion for scuba diving.

Before embarking on the adventure, one of our certified diving instructors will provide you with a thorough briefing. You will also be made aware of what you are in for through a PADI video session, which will inform you about the dos and don'ts. This session is of special benefit to beginners, who find it a very helpful tool in learning scuba diving.

Scuba Diving in Dubai

After going through the awareness sessions, we put on the specialized diving gear. We then take you to the diving spot, where you take the dive and swim deeper, accompanied by your safety instructor. You now immerse yourself in a whole new world, a brilliant showcase displaying marine life that thrives in the seas here. After the exhilarating experience, we come ashore. After you have completed the activity, we will give you a PADI certificate, something that you can show off to your friends.

For seasoned divers, we offer specially curated packages that include underwater photography sessions

Important Points to Note

  • You must bring your passport or Emirates ID; it's mandatory.
  • Participants must be at least 10 years of age.
  • We pick you up from your Dubai hotel/residence; no airport pick-ups are arranged. So, you can take transportation services from desertdaytravels.
  • Transfer arrangements are made if the option is chosen.
  • Divers who are between 10 and 17 years of age must furnish a medical liability form duly signed by their parents.
  • There's a 30-minute briefing session before the diving.
  • You should avoid taking a flight before 18 hours have passed after the activity.
  • The sessions may not always be available.
  • Scuba Diving can be combined with other water sports activities in Dubai.
  • You get the best scuba diving in Dubai price with us.

Best time for Scuba Diving

The best time to experience scuba diving in Dubai is from October to April when the weather is cooler and the sea conditions are ideal. During these months, the water visibility is excellent, and the marine life is abundant, providing an unforgettable diving experience.

At desertdaytravels, we ensure your day is packed with fun and excitement. Besides scuba diving, we offer a variety of thrilling water sports in Dubai for you to enjoy:

  • Jet Car 
  • Scuba Diving
  • Speed Boat Ride 
  • Jet Ski

FAQs

Q. Do I need to have prior experience in scuba diving?

No, you do not need prior experience in scuba diving. There are beginner courses available that teach you the basics of scuba diving and allow you to explore the underwater world with an experienced instructor. The trainers at the site will also teach you all you need to know about the different safety measures that one should take. All water sports in Dubai are perfectly safe.

Q. What equipment do I need for scuba diving?

You will need a scuba diving mask, fins, and a wetsuit. Other equipment, such as a regulator, and dive devices, will be provided by the dive centre. You will also be taught how to use them properly so that you have an enjoyable experience.

Q. Where can I get scuba diving tickets in Dubai? 

You can get scuba diving tickets in Dubai from desertdaytravels online. These scuba diving tickets include full diving equipment, free photos and videos, and a completion certificate.

Q. Are there any age restrictions for water sports in Dubai scuba diving?

Yes, there may be age restrictions for certain water sports and activities. For scuba diving, the minimum age is usually 10 years old, but this may vary depending on the dive centre. Other activities may have different age restrictions, so it's best to check with the activity provider. Make sure you find out about the different rules before you decide to sign up for such activities.

Q. What is scuba diving Dubai price?

The scuba diving in Dubai price starts from AED 450. You can have this amazing underwater experience with us at the best scuba diving in Dubai price.

Q. Is scuba diving safe?

Scuba diving is generally safe when proper safety procedures and guidelines are followed. It is important to get certified by a recognised training agency and dive with a reputable dive centre or instructor. You will always have an instructor accompanying you throughout the activity so there is no danger.

Q. What is the best time of year for water sports and scuba diving?

The best time of year for water sports and scuba diving varies depending on the location. Some destinations have year-round diving, while others have specific seasons for optimal diving conditions. It's best to research the destination and consult with a dive professional for the best time to visit. To enjoy it to the fullest, you can go during the winter, as the outside temperatures are quite tolerable.

Q. Can I go scuba diving if I wear glasses or contacts?

Yes, you can wear glasses or contacts while scuba diving, but it's important to choose the right equipment. Some dive centres offer prescription masks, which allow you to see underwater without your glasses or contacts. For those of you who wear contact lenses, wear protective swimming goggles to protect your eyes and the contact lenses.
